001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.render;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
005import java.util.Map;
006import java.util.stream.Stream;
007
008import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreCollectors.toLinkedMap;
009
010/**
011 * This class represents an immutable multidimensional {@link Map} of {@link Rule highlight rules},
012 * where the value of rule is either Ansi-Style or HTML-Style (mostly the color of text).
013 */
014public class Highlight {
015
016    /**
017     * The kind of JSON or YAML tokens to highlight
018     */
019    public enum Kind {
020        SYNTAX,
021        NULL,
022        KEY,
023        VALUE,
024        BG
025    }
026
027    /**
028     * The target logical structure of rendered document (<b>JSON</b> or <b>YAML</b>)
029     */
030    public enum Structure {
031        /**
032         * <a href="https://www.json.org/json-en.html">JSON</a>-structure of rendered document or fragment
033         * <hr/>
034         * (meaning of acronym is - <b>J</b>ava-<b>S</b>cript <b>O</b>bject <b>N</b>otation)
035         */
036        JSON,
037
038        /**
039         * <a href="https://yaml.org/spec/1.2.2/">YAML</a>-structure of rendered document or fragment
040         * <hr/>
041         * (meaning of acronym is - <b>Y</b>AML-<b>A</b>in't <b>M</b>arkup <b>L</b>anguage),<br/>
042         * which mostly means that YAML is a markup-language without markup-tags as XML or HTML
043         */
044        YAML
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * The target format of output (HTML-document/HTML-fragment, console with ANSI-escape sequences, ...)
049     */
050    public enum Target {
051
052        /**
053         * Txt-output format is mostly used to print the rendered document into terminal-console,
054         * where ANSI-escape sequences are used to highlight the different elements of documents
055         * <hr/>
056         * When saving intto {@code *.txt}-file - it's recommended to avoid rendering ANSI-escape sequences,
057         * which is automatically skipped by <a href="https://picocli.info/">picocli</a>
058         * <hr/>
059         * In tests and other environments ANSI-escape sequences will be rendered
060         * only of the system-property <b>{@code picocli.ansi}</b> equals to <b>{@code true}</b>
061         */
062        TXT_ANSI,
063
064        /**
065         * HTML-format, which does not require additional internal or external HTML-styles (in {@code *.css}-files)
066         */
067        HTML_STYLE,
068
069        /**
070         * HTML-format, without direct HTML-styles, but only with CSS-classes for different elements,
071         * that requires an additional internal or external HTML-styles (in {@code *.css}-files)
072         */
073        HTML_CSS,
074
075        /**
076         * This format could be used as a standalone SVG-image or HTML-fragment based on <b>{@literal <svg>}</b>-tag,
077         * where properties of font and fill-color are specified via attributes of <b>{@literal <tspan>}</b>-tag
078         */
079        SVG_ATTRS,
080
081        /**
082         * This format could be used as a standalone SVG-image or HTML-fragment based on <b>{@literal <svg>}</b>-tag,
083         * where SVG-attributes are encapsualted and provided via CSS-class of <b>{@literal <tspan>}</b>-tag
084         */
085        SVG_CLASS
086    }
087
088    /**
089     * This record represents a {@link Map.Entry#getKey() key} in multidimensional {@link Map}
090     * to store and lookup the highlight-rules.
091     *
092     * @param kind the kind of JSON or YAML tokens to highlight
093     * @param struct the target structure of rendered document (JSON or YAML)
094     * @param target the target format of output (ANSI, HTML, SVG, ...)
095     */
096    public record Place(
097        Kind kind,
098        Structure struct,
099        Target target
100    ) {
101        static Place of(Kind kind, Structure struct, Target target) {
102            return new Place(kind, struct, target);
103        }
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Individual highlight-rule - the correspondence between place and style to apply.
108     *
109     * @param kind the kind of JSON or YAML tokens to highlight
110     * @param struct the target structure of rendered document (JSON or YAML)
111     * @param target the target format of output (ANSI, HTML, SVG, ...)
112     * @param valueStr the string value of ANSI-Style, HTML-Style or HTML-CSS
113     */
114    public record Rule(
115        Kind kind,
116        Structure struct,
117        Target target,
118        String valueStr
119    ) {
120        Place place() {
121            return Place.of(kind, struct, target);
122        }
123        static Rule of(Kind kind, Structure struct, Target target, String valueStr) {
124            return new Rule(kind, struct, target, valueStr);
125        }
126    }
127
128    final private Map<Place, String> rulesMap;
129    private Highlight(Stream<Rule> rules) {
130        this.rulesMap = rules.collect(toLinkedMap(Rule::place, Rule::valueStr));
131    }
132    private Highlight(Highlight base, Stream<Rule> rulesOver) {
133        this.rulesMap = new LinkedHashMap<>(base.rulesMap);
134        rulesOver.forEach(rule -> this.rulesMap.put(rule.place(), rule.valueStr()));
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * @param place a place to look up the value for
139     * @return the string value of ANSI-Style, HTML-Style or HTML-CSS that correspond to that {@code place}
140     */
141    public String lookupValue(Place place) {
142        return rulesMap.get(place);
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * A factory-method to populate the multidimensional {@link Map} of {@link Rule highlight rules}
147     *
148     * @param rulesArr var-args-arrays of {@link Rule highlight rules}
149     * @return an immutable instance of {@link Highlight} class
150     */
151    public static Highlight highlight(Rule... rulesArr) {
152        return new Highlight(Arrays.stream(rulesArr));
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * A factory-method to extends/overwrite the {@code base} instance of {@link Highlight}
157     * with additional (substitutional) {@link Rule highlight rules}
158     *
159     * @param base a base instance of {@link Highlight} to extends/overwrite
160     * @param rulesArr {@link Rule highlight rules} to extends/overwrite with
161     * @return a new immutable instance of {@link Highlight} class, which is based on {@code base}
162     */
163    public static Highlight highlight(Highlight base, Rule... rulesArr) {
164        return new Highlight(base, Arrays.stream(rulesArr));
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * <b>no-highlighting</b> scheme (no {@link Rule highlight rules})
169     */
170    public static Highlight NONE = highlight();
171
172    /**
173     * The default highlight-scheme is based on: <ul>
174     *     <li><b>white</b> syntax ( '{@code "}', '<code>{</code>', '<code>}</code>',
175     *          '{@code [}', '{@code ]}', '{@code ,}', '{@code -}', '{@code :}' )</li>
176     *     <li><b>magenta</b> {@code null}s</li>
177     *     <li><b>blue</b> {@code key}s of JSON and YAML mappings</li>
178     *     <li><b>green</b> {@code value}s of JSON and YAML mappings and any scalars and sequence elements</li>
179     * </ul>
180     * As for HTML-style correspondence - the settings of well-known Python-library
181     * <a href="https://github.com/pycontribs/ansi2html/blob/main/src/ansi2html/style.py#L135-L153">
182     *     ansi2html (/src/ansi2html/style.py)
183     * </a>
184     * for "<i>basic</i>"<b> {@code MacOS-Terminal}</b> are used.
185     */
186    public static Highlight DEFAULT = highlight(
187        Rule.of(Kind.SYNTAX, Structure.JSON, Target.TXT_ANSI, "white"),
188        Rule.of(Kind.SYNTAX, Structure.JSON, Target.HTML_STYLE, "color: #808080;"),
189        Rule.of(Kind.SYNTAX, Structure.JSON, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "fill=\"#808080\""),
190        Rule.of(Kind.SYNTAX, Structure.YAML, Target.TXT_ANSI, "white"),
191        Rule.of(Kind.SYNTAX, Structure.YAML, Target.HTML_STYLE, "color: #808080;"),
192        Rule.of(Kind.SYNTAX, Structure.YAML, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "fill=\"#808080\""),
193
194        Rule.of(Kind.NULL, Structure.JSON, Target.TXT_ANSI, "magenta"),
195        Rule.of(Kind.NULL, Structure.JSON, Target.HTML_STYLE, "color: #800080;"),
196        Rule.of(Kind.NULL, Structure.JSON, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "fill=\"#800080\""),
197        Rule.of(Kind.NULL, Structure.YAML, Target.TXT_ANSI, "magenta"),
198        Rule.of(Kind.NULL, Structure.YAML, Target.HTML_STYLE, "color: #800080;"),
199        Rule.of(Kind.NULL, Structure.YAML, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "fill=\"#800080\""),
200
201        Rule.of(Kind.KEY, Structure.JSON, Target.TXT_ANSI, "blue"),
202        Rule.of(Kind.KEY, Structure.JSON, Target.HTML_STYLE, "color: #000080;"),
203        Rule.of(Kind.KEY, Structure.JSON, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "fill=\"#000080\""),
204        Rule.of(Kind.KEY, Structure.YAML, Target.TXT_ANSI, "blue"),
205        Rule.of(Kind.KEY, Structure.YAML, Target.HTML_STYLE, "color: #000080;"),
206        Rule.of(Kind.KEY, Structure.YAML, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "fill=\"#000080\""),
207
208        Rule.of(Kind.VALUE, Structure.JSON, Target.TXT_ANSI, "green"),
209        Rule.of(Kind.VALUE, Structure.JSON, Target.HTML_STYLE, "color: #008000;"),
210        Rule.of(Kind.VALUE, Structure.JSON, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "fill=\"#008000\""),
211        Rule.of(Kind.VALUE, Structure.YAML, Target.TXT_ANSI, "green"),
212        Rule.of(Kind.VALUE, Structure.YAML, Target.HTML_STYLE, "color: #008000;"),
213        Rule.of(Kind.VALUE, Structure.YAML, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "fill=\"#008000\""),
214
215        // in some other highlight-schema it's worth to try "background-color: transparent" or "opacity: [0.xxx;1.0]"
216        Rule.of(Kind.BG, Structure.JSON, Target.HTML_STYLE, "background-color: #FFFFFF;"),
217        Rule.of(Kind.BG, Structure.JSON, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "background-color: #FFFFFF;"),
218        Rule.of(Kind.BG, Structure.YAML, Target.HTML_STYLE, "background-color: #FFFFFF;"),
219        Rule.of(Kind.BG, Structure.YAML, Target.SVG_ATTRS, "background-color: #FFFFFF;")
220    );
221}
